resources.string: Couldn\'t find app to select a contact
\"Attach Contact\" can\'t provide vCard files without being granted access to your contacts
In order to provide vCard files, \"Attach Contact\" needs access to your contacts.
This app allows you to attach your contacts as vCard (.vcf) files when composing an email.

1. Open the **compose screen** of your **email app** by creating a new message or replying to an existing email.
 1. Locate the button that allows you to add an attachment using **Android's file picker**.\
 Note: Some email apps only use the system file picker for images/photos. For this reason *%1$s* pretends to support images.
 1. In Android's file picker screen you can find the "**%2$s**" option in the side drawer.
 1. If this is the first time, you will be asked to **grant** this app the **permission** to access your contacts.
 1. Afterwards your contacts app will be launched for you to **choose a contact**.
 1. This app will then pass the contact's data as vCard (.vcf) file to the email app.
